guidelines.section: Asset Allocation
guidelines.text: Global Equity has a Target of 57%, a Minimum of 50%, and a Maximum of 64%.

guidelines.section: Asset Allocation
guidelines.text: Stable Value has a Target of 21%, a Minimum of 14%, and a Maximum of 28%.
guidelines.provenance: Executive Summary, Asset Allocation Table, page 4

guidelines.section: Asset Allocation
guidelines.text: Real Return has a Target of 21%, a Minimum of 14%, and a Maximum of 28%.
guidelines.provenance: Executive Summary, Asset Allocation Table, page 4

guidelines.section: Asset Allocation
guidelines.text: Risk Parity has a Target of 5%, a Minimum of 0%, and a Maximum of 10%.

guidelines.section: Asset Allocation
guidelines.text: Net Asset Allocation Leverage has a Target of -4%.
guidelines.provenance: Executive Summary, Asset Allocation Table, page 4

guidelines.section: Asset Allocation
guidelines.text: In addition to the target for each broad asset class category target, there are specific targets for subcategories with minimum and maximum ranges that are +/-5% around the target allocation, with certain exceptions.

guidelines.section: Tracking Error
guidelines.text: The neutral tracking error target for Equity (US) is 300 basis points.
guidelines.provenance: Executive Summary, Tracking Error Table, page 5

guidelines.text: The neutral tracking error target for Equity (International; Non-US, EAFE) is 300 basis points.

guidelines.text: The neutral tracking error target for Equity (International; Emerging Markets) is 300 basis points.

guidelines.section: Tracking Error
guidelines.text: The neutral tracking error target for Equity (All Country) is 300 basis points.
guidelines.provenance: Executive Summary, Tracking Error Table, page 5

guidelines.section: Tracking Error
guidelines.text: The neutral tracking error target for Stable Value Hedge Funds is 400 basis points.
guidelines.provenance: Executive Summary, Tracking Error Table, page 5

guidelines.section: Tracking Error
guidelines.text: The neutral tracking error target for Risk Parity is 400 basis points.
guidelines.provenance: Executive Summary, Tracking Error Table, page 5

guidelines.section: Tracking Error
guidelines.text: The maximum tracking error target for Government Bonds – Nominal is 300 basis points.

guidelines.text: The maximum tracking error target for Government Bonds - Real is 300 basis points.

guidelines.section: Tracking Error
guidelines.text: The neutral tracking error target for Total Public Fund is 100 basis points and the maximum is 300 basis points.
guidelines.provenance: Executive Summary, Tracking Error Table, page 5

guidelines.section: 1.3 Roles of Board, Staff, Advisors, and Consultants
guidelines.text: The Internal Investment Committee (the “IIC”) reviews, considers, and authorizes proposed investments and external manager engagements as required by this Policy.

guidelines.section: 1.3 Roles of Board, Staff, Advisors, and Consultants
guidelines.text: Additionally, the IIC will manage the currency hedge ratios (set forth in Appendix C) and review as needed.

guidelines.section: 1.3 Roles of Board, Staff, Advisors, and Consultants
guidelines.text: A prudence or recommendation letter will be required in the following circumstances: When the Board considers authorizing an external investment opportunity because the allocation or commitment exceeds the limits in Appendix B;

guidelines.section: 1.3 Roles of Board, Staff, Advisors, and Consultants
guidelines.text: A prudence or recommendation letter will be required in the following circumstances: When the CIO, Executive Director, or a Board member requests a letter for any external investment opportunity presented to the IIC; or

guidelines.section: 1.3 Roles of Board, Staff, Advisors, and Consultants
guidelines.text: A prudence or recommendation letter will be required in the following circumstances: When an external investment opportunity presented to the IIC meets all three of the following criteria: i. The investment will reside in the principal investment Private Markets Portfolio; ii. The initial allocation or commitment exceeds 0.25% of the Total Fund value; and iii. The investment is the first by TRS with a manager organization.

guidelines.section: 1.3 Roles of Board, Staff, Advisors, and Consultants
guidelines.text: All proposed changes to this Policy will be reviewed by Legal and Compliance for compliance with state and federal laws regarding fiduciary responsibility, investment prudence, regulatory compliance, ethics compliance, and other applicable standards or requirements before submission to the Governance Committee.

guidelines.section: 1.3 Roles of Board, Staff, Advisors, and Consultants
guidelines.text: This Policy shall be reviewed at least once every three years.

guidelines.section: 1.3 Roles of Board, Staff, Advisors, and Consultants
guidelines.text: The Investment Division is authorized to engage qualified Consultants on an as-needed basis to assist the Investment Division with respect to investment opportunities and to provide other investment due diligence, analysis and advice.

guidelines.section: 1.4 Total Fund Objectives
guidelines.text: Control risk through proper diversification of asset classes and by establishing long-term risk and return expectations; and

guidelines.section: 1.4 Total Fund Objectives
guidelines.text: As applicable to the pension plan, achieve a long-term rate of return that: Exceeds the assumed actuarial rate of return adopted by the Board;

guidelines.section: 1.4 Total Fund Objectives
guidelines.text: As applicable to the pension plan, achieve a long-term rate of return that: Exceeds the long-term rate of inflation by an annualized 5%; and

guidelines.section: 1.4 Total Fund Objectives
guidelines.text: As applicable to the pension plan, achieve a long-term rate of return that: Exceeds the return of the Fund Policy Benchmark.

guidelines.section: 1.5 Total Fund Investment Standard
guidelines.text: All investments must be made prudently and in accordance with fiduciary and ethical standards, without promoting interests unrelated to the portfolio's stated objectives of controlling risk and achieving a long-term rate of return.

guidelines.section: 1.5 Total Fund Investment Standard
guidelines.text: All investments made by the Total Fund must be in “securities" as provided by Article XVI, Section 67 (a)(3) of the Texas Constitution and defined in Texas Government Code Section 825.301.

guidelines.section: 1.6 Total Fund Asset Mix and Benchmarks
guidelines.text: The Investment Division will assist the Board in engaging in an asset-liability study for the pension plan at least once every five years to review asset classes, return-risk assumptions, and correlation of returns with applicable benchmarks and across asset classes.

guidelines.section: 1.6 Total Fund Asset Mix and Benchmarks
guidelines.text: Global Equity: All Country has a target allocation of 39%, with a minimum of 29% and a maximum of 44%. The benchmark is MSCI All Country World Investible Market ex China and Hong Kong.

structured.benchmark: MSCI All Country World Investible Market ex China and Hong Kong⁴

guidelines.section: 1.6 Total Fund Asset Mix and Benchmarks
guidelines.text: Global Equity: USA has a target allocation of 0%, with a minimum of -5% and a maximum of 5%. The benchmark is MSCI USA Investible Market.

guidelines.section: 1.6 Total Fund Asset Mix and Benchmarks
guidelines.text: Global Equity: Non-US Developed has a target allocation of 5%, with a minimum of 0% and a maximum of 10%. The benchmark is MSCI EAFE and Canada Investible Market ex Hong Kong.

structured.benchmark: MSCI EAFE and Canada Investible Market ex Hong Kong⁴

guidelines.section: 1.6 Total Fund Asset Mix and Benchmarks
guidelines.text: Global Equity: Emerging Markets has a target allocation of 1%, with a minimum of -4% and a maximum of 6%. The benchmark is MSCI EM Investible Market ex China.

structured.benchmark: MSCI EM Investible Market ex China⁴

guidelines.section: 1.6 Total Fund Asset Mix and Benchmarks
guidelines.text: Global Equity: Private Equity has a target allocation of 12%, with a minimum of 7% and a maximum of 19%. The benchmark is Customized State Street Private Equity Index - lagged one quarter.

structured.benchmark: Customized State Street Private Equity Index - lagged one quarter⁵

guidelines.section: 1.6 Total Fund Asset Mix and Benchmarks
guidelines.text: Total Global Equity has a target allocation of 57%, with a minimum of 50% and a maximum of 64%.

guidelines.section: 1.6 Total Fund Asset Mix and Benchmarks
guidelines.text: Stable Value: Government Bonds - Nominal has a target allocation of 10%, with a minimum of 0% and a maximum of 15%. The benchmark is Bloomberg US Long Treasury Index.

guidelines.section: 1.6 Total Fund Asset Mix and Benchmarks
guidelines.text: Stable Value: Government Bonds - Real has a target allocation of 6%, with a minimum of 0% and a maximum of 11%. The benchmark is Bloomberg US Treasury TIPS Index.

guidelines.section: 1.6 Total Fund Asset Mix and Benchmarks
guidelines.text: Stable Value: Absolute Return (Including Credit Sensitive Investments) has a target allocation of 0%, with a minimum of 0% and a maximum of 10%. The benchmark is SOFR + 4%.

structured.asset_class: Absolute Return (Including Credit Sensitive Investments)⁶, ⁸

guidelines.section: 1.6 Total Fund Asset Mix and Benchmarks
guidelines.text: Stable Value: Stable Value Hedge Funds⁸ has a target allocation of 5%, with a minimum of 0% and a maximum of 10%. The benchmark is SOFR + 2.5%.

guidelines.section: 1.6 Total Fund Asset Mix and Benchmarks
guidelines.text: Total Stable Value has a target allocation of 21%, with a minimum of 14% and a maximum of 28%.

guidelines.section: 1.6 Total Fund Asset Mix and Benchmarks
guidelines.text: Real Return: Real Estate has a target allocation of 15%, with a minimum of 10% and a maximum of 20%. The benchmark is NCREIF ODCE – lagged one quarter.

guidelines.section: 1.6 Total Fund Asset Mix and Benchmarks
guidelines.text: Real Return: Energy, Natural Resources and Infrastructure has a target allocation of 6%, with a minimum of 1% and a maximum of 11%. The benchmark is 40% Cambridge Associates Natural Resources/40% Cambridge Associates Infrastructure/20% quarterly Consumer Price Index- lagged one quarter.

structured.benchmark: 40% Cambridge Associates Natural Resources/40% Cambridge Associates Infrastructure/20% quarterly Consumer Price Index- lagged one quarter

guidelines.section: 1.6 Total Fund Asset Mix and Benchmarks
guidelines.text: Real Return: Commodities has a target allocation of 0%, with a minimum of 0% and a maximum of 5%. The benchmark is Goldman Sachs Commodity Index.

guidelines.section: 1.6 Total Fund Asset Mix and Benchmarks
guidelines.text: Total Real Return has a target allocation of 21%, with a minimum of 14% and a maximum of 28%.

guidelines.section: 1.6 Total Fund Asset Mix and Benchmarks
guidelines.text: Risk Parity: Risk Parity has a target allocation of 5%, with a minimum of 0% and a maximum of 10%. The benchmark is HFR Risk Parity Vol 12 Institutional Index.

structured.benchmark: HFR Risk Parity Vol 12 Institutional Index

guidelines.section: 1.6 Total Fund Asset Mix and Benchmarks
guidelines.text: Asset Allocation Leverage: Cash has a target allocation of 2%, with a minimum of 0% and a maximum of 7%. The benchmark is FTSE 3 Month Treasury Bill.

guidelines.section: 1.6 Total Fund Asset Mix and Benchmarks
guidelines.text: Asset Allocation Leverage: Asset Allocation Leverage has a target allocation of -6%. The benchmark is SOFR + 26.161 bp.

guidelines.section: 1.6 Total Fund Asset Mix and Benchmarks
guidelines.text: Net Asset Allocation Leverage has a target allocation of -4%.

guidelines.section: 1.6 Total Fund Asset Mix and Benchmarks
guidelines.text: With respect to the maximum range and minimum range, the CIO may increase any maximum range by 5% or decrease any minimum range by 5% (but may not decrease a minimum range below zero) if the CIO concludes in a writing delivered to the Executive Director and to the Board of Trustees stating the action taken and the reasons why the CIO believes that such increase or decrease would be in the best interests of TRS; provided, the maximum range for Total Global Equity may not be increased above 68%.

guidelines.section: 1.6 Total Fund Asset Mix and Benchmarks
guidelines.text: Before taking action, the CIO must request comments from the Chair of the appropriate Board committee and TRS Advisors.

guidelines.section: 1.6 Total Fund Asset Mix and Benchmarks
guidelines.text: The Board, at the next succeeding Board meeting, must authorize the increase or decrease if the CIO proposes that the changes continue in effect after such Board meeting.

guidelines.section: 1.6 Total Fund Asset Mix and Benchmarks
guidelines.text: If the Board does not authorize the continuation of the change to a maximum or minimum range after the next succeeding Board meeting, the Investment Division shall use best efforts to rebalance the portfolio to bring the asset classes within the ranges in the table above within 90 days.

guidelines.section: 1.6 Total Fund Asset Mix and Benchmarks
guidelines.text: To calculate the Total Fund benchmark, the benchmark weight of each of Private Equity, Real Estate, and Energy, Natural Resources, and Infrastructure, will be set each quarter as the ending actual weight from the prior quarter. Any difference in the calculated Private Equity, Real Estate and Energy, Natural Resources, and Infrastructure benchmark weights from the target benchmark weights will be offset using other asset classes with 55% of such difference applied to All Country, 7% to Non- US Developed, 1% to Emerging Markets, 7% to Stable Value Hedge Funds, 7% to Risk Parity, 14% to Government Bonds - Nominal and 9% to Government Bonds - Real.

guidelines.section: 1.6 Total Fund Asset Mix and Benchmarks
guidelines.text: The Investment Division does not normally manage the allocations to Private Equity, Real Estate and Energy, Natural Resources, and Infrastructure on a tactical basis and will use its best efforts to achieve the Target allocation for these assets classes; provided, with notification to and comment sought from the Chair of the appropriate Board committee, the Investment Division may seek to achieve a higher or lower Target so long as such Target is within the Minimum Range and the Maximum Range.

guidelines.section: 1.6 Total Fund Asset Mix and Benchmarks
guidelines.text: Allocation to USA and Emerging Markets may only be negative if offset by allocations within the All Country asset class.

guidelines.section: 1.6 Total Fund Asset Mix and Benchmarks
guidelines.text: Benchmarks will be adjusted for transitions authorized by Policy and for securities TRS is not authorized to own or buy because of this Policy or statutory provisions for which no fiduciary exemption has been exercised and have the Bloomberg Tickers of NU757432, GU722807, NU722808, and NU722809.

guidelines.section: 1.6 Total Fund Asset Mix and Benchmarks
guidelines.text: The benchmark will exclude funds with size of $1 billion or less and will be adjusted to match the vintage year of the Private Equity Portfolio commingled fund commitments.

guidelines.section: 1.6 Total Fund Asset Mix and Benchmarks
guidelines.text: The benchmark will be compounded daily using SOFRRATE index with a one-day lag, Actual/360, and Modified Following day count conventions.

guidelines.section: 1.6 Total Fund Asset Mix and Benchmarks
guidelines.text: The Maximum Range for the Private Equity Asset Class will change to 17% and the Minimum Range for the All Country Asset Class will change to 34% on October 1, 2027.

guidelines.section: 1.7 Total Fund Measurement and Reporting Criteria
guidelines.text: Investment Performance – Investment performance for the Total Fund and each component portfolio, net of external management fees (if applicable), will be compared with their respective benchmark indices. Fund performance will be judged primarily by comparisons to long-term (three, five, and ten year) Policy Benchmark returns.

guidelines.section: 1.7 Total Fund Measurement and Reporting Criteria
guidelines.text: Monitoring of compliance with Policy – Portfolios will be reviewed for compliance with the requirements set forth in this Policy. The Chief Compliance Officer will have overall responsibility for compliance monitoring. However, if considered necessary, TRS will hire external parties to obtain assistance regarding compliance monitoring. To ensure independence in compliance monitoring, the Chief Compliance Officer or external parties hired will not be given the authority to trade securities. To ensure ongoing compliance with this Policy and completeness of disclosures to the Board regarding compliance, the Chief Compliance Officer has authority to require certifications from applicable IIC members or Managing Directors disclosing known compliance violations. The Chief Compliance Officer reports all known compliance exceptions to the Board at the next meeting of the Board.

guidelines.section: 1.7 Total Fund Measurement and Reporting Criteria
guidelines.text: Asset class exposures and weight – The exposure of cash and derivative instruments to each asset class will be aggregated and compared with their respective benchmarks and with the authorized ranges around those benchmarks. The foregoing does not apply to those accounts designated as using Strategy Leverage to better align the investment with the characteristics of the policy benchmark. Hedge Fund exposure will be reported relative to the limit set by the Board, if applicable.

guidelines.section: 1.7 Total Fund Measurement and Reporting Criteria
guidelines.text: For any external investment under consideration by the Investment Division (including Hedge Funds, External Managers, and private markets investments), the Investment Division will provide the Board the following information prior to the date of the applicable IIC meeting: Anticipated name of the investment vehicle and name of investment manager;

guidelines.section: 1.7 Total Fund Measurement and Reporting Criteria
guidelines.text: For any external investment under consideration by the Investment Division...the Investment Division will provide the Board the following information...: Total fund or strategy size;

guidelines.section: 1.7 Total Fund Measurement and Reporting Criteria
guidelines.text: For any external investment under consideration by the Investment Division...the Investment Division will provide the Board the following information...: TRS investment amount under consideration;

guidelines.section: 1.7 Total Fund Measurement and Reporting Criteria
guidelines.text: For any external investment under consideration by the Investment Division...the Investment Division will provide the Board the following information...: Investment strategy;

guidelines.section: 1.7 Total Fund Measurement and Reporting Criteria
guidelines.text: For any external investment under consideration by the Investment Division...the Investment Division will provide the Board the following information...: Names of the External Manager or fund principals;

guidelines.section: 1.7 Total Fund Measurement and Reporting Criteria
guidelines.text: For any external investment under consideration by the Investment Division...the Investment Division will provide the Board the following information...: Placement agent or firm sponsoring the offering or engagement, if any;

guidelines.section: 1.7 Total Fund Measurement and Reporting Criteria
guidelines.text: For any external investment under consideration by the Investment Division...the Investment Division will provide the Board the following information...: Prospective fees;

guidelines.section: 1.7 Total Fund Measurement and Reporting Criteria
guidelines.text: For any external investment under consideration by the Investment Division...the Investment Division will provide the Board the following information...: Other TRS investments with the firm;

guidelines.section: 1.7 Total Fund Measurement and Reporting Criteria
guidelines.text: For any external investment under consideration by the Investment Division...the Investment Division will provide the Board the following information...: Historical fund or manager performance; and

guidelines.section: 1.7 Total Fund Measurement and Reporting Criteria
guidelines.text: For any internal investment under consideration, the Investment Division will provide the Board similar information prior to the date of the applicable IIC meeting.

guidelines.section: 1.7 Total Fund Measurement and Reporting Criteria
guidelines.text: External investments activities– The Investment Division will provide the Board with a list of all external investments, including any additions, withdrawals, transfers, or terminations, on at least a semi-annual basis.

guidelines.section: 1.7 Total Fund Measurement and Reporting Criteria
guidelines.text: Derivatives – The Investment Division will provide a comprehensive report of all outstanding derivative applications (including derivative types, counterparties, notional amounts, and fair values) used by internal managers and External Managers under IMAs on at least a semi-annual basis.

guidelines.section: 1.7 Total Fund Measurement and Reporting Criteria
guidelines.text: Risk limits – The Investment Division will report at least semi-annually the Total Fund and benchmark total estimated risk relative to the upper and lower bounds corresponding to the maximum and minimum downside risk measures that could be achieved through the asset allocation limits in this Policy.

guidelines.section: 1.7 Total Fund Measurement and Reporting Criteria
guidelines.text: Liquidity – The Investment Division will report at least semi-annually to the Board the use of external liquidity funding mechanisms.

guidelines.section: 1.7 Total Fund Measurement and Reporting Criteria
guidelines.text: Leverage – The Investment Division will report Gross Leverage, Net Asset Allocation Leverage, and Strategy Leverage for portfolios including, but not limited to, Risk Parity and Hedge Funds and leverage resulting from use of external liquidity funding mechanisms as outlined in Section 10.4 Liquidity Risk Management on at least a semi-annual basis.

guidelines.section: 1.7 Total Fund Measurement and Reporting Criteria
guidelines.text: Private Markets Long-Term Strategy – The Investment Division will review with the Board its long-term strategy for each Private Markets Portfolio at least every three years. This review will include information on target sub- strategy allocation, return, risk, and liquidity expectations. Tactical deviations from this long-term strategy will be reviewed with the Board on an annual basis.

guidelines.section: 1.8 Total Fund Portfolio Implementation and Design; Restrictions
guidelines.text: In no event shall the aggregate allocation to External Managers pursuant to IMAs exceed 30% (or a different percentage of not more than 50%, if a greater percentage is specified in the Texas Government Code) of the Total Fund at the time of investment.

guidelines.section: 1.8 Total Fund Portfolio Implementation and Design; Restrictions
guidelines.text: For avoidance of doubt, this restriction does not apply to assets held by funds (including Hedge Funds) which limit the liability of TRS to the capital contributed and any distributions that TRS might be legally obligated to contribute or repay to the fund.

guidelines.section: 1.8 Total Fund Portfolio Implementation and Design; Restrictions
guidelines.text: Subject to Appendix F, the Investment Division is authorized to represent TRS on: Advisory committees or boards and as board observers in investments in which TRS has an investment interest.

guidelines.section: 1.8 Total Fund Portfolio Implementation and Design; Restrictions
guidelines.text: After evaluation of the net benefit to TRS, employees in the Investment Division are authorized to represent TRS or to nominate or appoint third-party independent non-employees to represent TRS on the governing body of a non-public (private) or a publicly-traded business entity in which TRS holds a direct or indirect investment interest.

guidelines.section: 1.8 Total Fund Portfolio Implementation and Design; Restrictions
guidelines.text: Except as required by fiduciary duties created by the Texas Constitution or applicable law, each TRS investment portfolio, including separate account investments, will comply with prohibitions and restrictions on investments imposed on TRS by state law.

guidelines.section: 2.2 Public Markets Portfolios Authorized Investments
guidelines.text: The Public Markets Portfolios are authorized to invest in the following: All securities in a Policy Benchmark, all securities that trade publicly (whether on an exchange or over the counter) or pursuant to SEC Rule 144A, and securities issued in underwritten initial public offerings (“IPOs”);

guidelines.section: 2.2 Public Markets Portfolios Authorized Investments
guidelines.text: The Public Markets Portfolios are authorized to invest in the following: Fixed income securities, whether publicly traded or restricted;

guidelines.section: 2.2 Public Markets Portfolios Authorized Investments
guidelines.text: The Public Markets Portfolios are authorized to invest in the following: Restricted Securities which are expected to become public or otherwise freely marketable within three years after the initial investment date pursuant to registration or an exemption from registration;

guidelines.section: 2.2 Public Markets Portfolios Authorized Investments
guidelines.text: The Public Markets Portfolios are authorized to invest in the following: Derivatives in accordance with Article 9;

guidelines.section: 2.2 Public Markets Portfolios Authorized Investments
guidelines.text: The Public Markets Portfolios are authorized to invest in the following: Private Investment Funds including Hedge Funds; and

guidelines.section: 2.2 Public Markets Portfolios Authorized Investments
guidelines.text: The Public Markets Portfolios are authorized to invest in the following: Cash and cash equivalents.

guidelines.section: 2.3 Public Markets Portfolios Restrictions
guidelines.text: Not more than 20% of the outstanding equity securities of a single class of any company may be purchased. Securities which are deemed to be beneficially held by TRS for purposes of Section 13 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 (including equity securities held in an IMA or a Private Fund in which TRS is deemed to be the beneficial owner for purposes of Section 13), shall be counted against the 20% limit.

guidelines.section: 2.3 Public Markets Portfolios Restrictions
guidelines.text: The Public Markets Portfolios shall conform to the tracking error targets prescribed in Appendix A.

guidelines.section: 2.3 Public Markets Portfolios Restrictions
guidelines.text: The Public Markets Portfolios that are managed directly by the Investment Division may hold short positions in securities listed in Section 2.2.

guidelines.section: 2.3 Public Markets Portfolios Restrictions
guidelines.text: The aggregate short positions exposure excluding derivatives of the portfolios may not exceed 25% of the market value of the internal equity portfolios without the prior written consent of the CIO.

guidelines.section: 2.3 Public Markets Portfolios Restrictions
guidelines.text: In no event may the aggregate short positions exposure of the internal equity portfolios exceed 50% of the market value of the internal equity portfolios, nor may any short sale or position violate the laws or rules of any jurisdiction or exchange in or on which the applicable securities are traded or listed.

guidelines.section: 2.3 Public Markets Portfolios Restrictions
guidelines.text: The market value of Restricted Securities purchased in Public Markets Portfolios pursuant to 2.2c will not exceed 2% of the market value of the Total Fund at time of investment.

guidelines.section: 2.3 Public Markets Portfolios Restrictions
guidelines.text: Not more than 15% of the Total Fund may be invested in Hedge Funds. Compliance with this limit is determined at the time TRS executes the investment documents for each Hedge Fund investment or additional investment.

guidelines.section: 2.6 External Public Markets Portfolio Authorization
guidelines.text: The EPM Portfolios may hold short positions in securities authorized under Section 2.2.

guidelines.section: 2.6 External Public Markets Portfolio Authorization
guidelines.text: The aggregate short positions exposure of the External Manager Portfolio may not exceed 25% of the market value of the External Manager Portfolio without the prior written consent of the CIO.

guidelines.section: 2.6 External Public Markets Portfolio Authorization
guidelines.text: In no event may the aggregate short positions exposure of the External Manager Portfolio exceed 50% of the market value of the External Manager Portfolio, nor may any short sale or position violate the laws or rules of any jurisdiction or exchange in or on which the applicable Securities are traded or listed.

guidelines.section: 2.6 External Public Markets Portfolio Authorization
guidelines.text: Allocation Adjustment Authority – Subject to the limits set forth in this Policy, the CIO, CRO, the heads of Public Markets, EPM, or Special Opportunities may add to previously approved funds or investments for the purposes of rebalancing, increasing allocations or adjusting risks. Such additional investments or allocations shall not, on a monthly basis, exceed 2% of the Hedge Fund Portfolio, External Manager Portfolio, or Absolute Return Portfolio (as appropriate) per investment.

guidelines.section: 2.7 External Public Markets Portfolio Restrictions
guidelines.text: IMAs, considered in the aggregate, may not be used to circumvent the asset allocation parameters, risk guidelines, or any other controls otherwise established by this Policy, including the provisions of Section 2.2.

guidelines.section: 2.7 External Public Markets Portfolio Restrictions
guidelines.text: The EPM Portfolios are subject to the size limitations in Section 1.8b.

guidelines.section: 2.7 External Public Markets Portfolio Restrictions
guidelines.text: Each IMA with an External Manager shall specify the applicable policies, risk controls, portfolio characteristics, reporting requirements, requirements or restrictions, including criteria for determining quality of investments or the use of standard debt-rating services.

guidelines.section: 2.8 External Public Markets Portfolio Conflicts of Interest
guidelines.text: Conflicts of interest, including the appearance of conflicts, in the selection and engagement of external investment managers will be avoided at all times.

guidelines.section: 3.2 Private Markets Portfolios Authorization
guidelines.text: It will not be a violation of this Policy if changes in the market values of the public assets portfolios or the Private Markets Portfolios cause the market value of the Private Markets Portfolios to exceed the upper limit of the allocation ranges established in this Policy.

guidelines.section: 3.2 Private Markets Portfolios Authorization
guidelines.text: Investment Authority. The limits defined and set forth in Appendix B apply to allocations and commitments by the Private Markets Portfolios.

guidelines.section: 3.2 Private Markets Portfolios Authorization
guidelines.text: Additional Allocation Authority. Subject to the limits set forth in this Policy, the CIO or, as applicable, the heads of the Private Markets, Private Equity, Real Estate, or Energy, Natural Resources, and Infrastructure Portfolios may add funds to previously approved investments for the purposes of rebalancing, increasing allocations or adjusting risks. Such additional investments or allocations shall not exceed, on a monthly basis, 2% of each of the Private Equity Portfolio, the Real Estate Portfolio, or the ENRI Portfolio (respectively, as appropriate) per investment.

guidelines.section: 4.3 Private Equity Portfolio Restrictions
guidelines.text: The Private Equity Portfolio is authorized by and is subject to the terms and conditions described in Article 3.

guidelines.section: 5.1 Real Estate Portfolio Objectives
guidelines.text: No specific geographic diversification or leverage targets are required.

guidelines.section: 5.3 Real Estate Portfolio Restrictions
guidelines.text: The RE Portfolio is authorized by and is subject to the terms and conditions described in Article 3.

guidelines.section: 6.1 Energy, Natural Resources and Infrastructure Portfolio
guidelines.text: No specific geographic diversification or leverage targets are required.

guidelines.section: 6.2 Energy Natural Resources and Infrastructure Portfolio Authorized Investments
guidelines.text: Direct investments in physical commodities are prohibited.

guidelines.section: 6.3 Energy, Natural Resources and Infrastructure Portfolio Restrictions
guidelines.text: The ENRI Portfolio is authorized by and is subject to the terms and conditions described in Article 3.

guidelines.section: 7.1 Emerging Manager Program
guidelines.text: The Emerging Managers Program will target 1.1% of the market value of the Total Fund.

guidelines.section: 7.1 Emerging Manager Program
guidelines.text: Each investment will have a minimum size of $5 million.

guidelines.section: 7.1 Emerging Manager Program
guidelines.text: With respect to the EPM Portfolio, the total investment by TRS with each emerging manager may not exceed 40% of such emerging manager's assets under management at the time of IIC approval.

guidelines.section: 7.1 Emerging Manager Program
guidelines.text: With respect to the Private Equity Portfolio and the Real Estate Portfolio, the total investment by TRS into each fund raised by an emerging manager may not exceed 40% of the size of such fund at the time of IIC approval.

guidelines.section: 7.1 Emerging Manager Program
guidelines.text: This paragraph does not apply to investments executed as part of a fund-of-funds mandate.

guidelines.section: 8.3 Overlay Portfolios Restrictions
guidelines.text: Overlay Portfolios may not be used to circumvent the asset allocation parameters, risk guidelines, or any other controls or restrictions otherwise established by this Policy or applicable law.

guidelines.section: 8.3 Overlay Portfolios Restrictions
guidelines.text: When engaging in currency overlay strategies, the Overlay Portfolio may not increase or decrease the net notional exposure of the Total Fund: To all non-dollar currencies in aggregate by more than 5% of the market value of the Total Fund;

guidelines.section: 8.3 Overlay Portfolios Restrictions
guidelines.text: When engaging in currency overlay strategies, the Overlay Portfolio may not increase or decrease the net notional exposure of the Total Fund: To any single developed market currency (except for the U.S. Dollar) by more than 2% of the market value of the Total Fund; and

guidelines.section: 8.3 Overlay Portfolios Restrictions
guidelines.text: When engaging in currency overlay strategies, the Overlay Portfolio may not increase or decrease the net notional exposure of the Total Fund: To any single emerging market currency by more than 1% of the market value of the Total Fund.

guidelines.section: 8.3 Overlay Portfolios Restrictions
guidelines.text: The foregoing percentage limit restrictions do not apply to currency derivatives used (i) as part of the non-discretionary foreign exchange risk management policy described in Section 10.2, (ii) to settle security transactions denominated in those foreign currencies and any authorized instrument or contract intended to manage transaction or currency exchange risk in purchasing and selling investments, and (iii) for hedging the characteristics of an individual investment to align it with the characteristics of such investment's benchmark.

guidelines.section: 9.5 Derivatives Applications Not Permitted
guidelines.text: Derivatives may not be used for speculation. Derivatives are considered speculative if their uses have no material relation to objectives and strategies specified by this Policy or any related policies or resolutions of the Board. Derivatives may not be used for circumventing limitations or restrictions imposed by this Policy or applicable regulatory requirements. Derivative applications may only be used to invest in asset classes that are consistent with TRS' legally permissible policy asset categories (including currencies), implementation strategies, and risk-return characteristics.

guidelines.section: 9.5 Derivatives Applications Not Permitted
guidelines.text: Investments in derivatives underlain by physical commodities are prohibited unless such derivatives can be cash- settled whether by contract terms, by rolling the position, or by trading out of the position before a delivery obligation can arise. Standing orders or instructions for rolling or trading out of positions may be used to prevent delivery obligations from arising under commodities derivatives contracts.

guidelines.section: 9.7 Derivatives Limitations
guidelines.text: Any external counterparty in an OTC derivative transaction with TRS must have a credit rating (which may be a counterparty risk assessment or rating) of at least A- (Standard & Poor's or Fitch) or A3 (Moody's).

guidelines.section: 9.7 Derivatives Limitations
guidelines.text: All external OTC derivative transactions, including those managed through IMAs, must be subject to established ISDA Master Agreements or, if centrally cleared, clearing agreements and have full documentation of all legal obligations of both parties to each transaction.

guidelines.section: 9.7 Derivatives Limitations
guidelines.text: All ISDA Master Agreements entered into by or on behalf of TRS by the Investment Division or an External Manager engaged pursuant to an IMA (if applicable) shall provide for netting of obligations.

guidelines.section: 9.7 Derivatives Limitations
guidelines.text: The net market value of all OTC derivative positions, including those managed through IMAs, less collateral posted, for any individual counterparty may not exceed $500 million.

guidelines.section: 9.7 Derivatives Limitations
guidelines.text: The net market value of all OTC derivative positions for any individual counterparty, without consideration of collateral, may not exceed 5% of the total market value of the Fund.

guidelines.section: 9.7 Derivatives Limitations
guidelines.text: Global Risk Limitations: Notwithstanding other limitations in this Policy, transactions that would cause the aggregate risk exposure of the Total Fund, including externally-managed portfolios, to exceed the aggregate risk limits established by the current asset allocation policies of the Board are not permitted.

guidelines.section: 9.7 Derivatives Limitations
guidelines.text: Position Limits: For futures and options positions TRS will comply with all position and aggregate limits established by the applicable regulatory and legal organizations and authorities within each jurisdiction.

guidelines.section: 10.1 Market Risk Management
guidelines.text: Asset allocation limits – In addition to the Total Fund Portfolio level risk limits, the portfolio will be constrained to the asset allocation percentages and ranges prescribed by this Policy. Accordingly, the total exposure to each asset class must be based on the individual exposures of each cash security and each outstanding derivative contract. The foregoing does not apply to those accounts designated as using strategy leverage to better align the investment with the characteristics of the policy benchmark.

guidelines.section: 10.1 Market Risk Management
guidelines.text: Active risk limits – In addition to the portfolio-level risk statistics described above, a target tracking error will be imposed on each public asset class mandate. Additionally, a target tracking error will be imposed on the entire public portfolio that takes into account both internally and externally managed portfolios and Private Funds as well as both asset allocation and security selection decisions. These limits are specified in Appendix A.

guidelines.section: 10.2 Foreign-Exchange Risk Management
guidelines.text: Currency hedge ratios will be separately applied to the Fund's public-markets and private-markets non-dollar exposures. Each currency hedge ratio is the percentage of aggregate, non-dollar currency exposure to be passively hedged. The hedging horizon is intermediate (one to three years). The results of the currency hedge ratio decisions will be presented to the Board (or the appropriate Board committee, as applicable) for approval by the Board and incorporated into the benchmark as prescribed in Appendix C.

guidelines.section: 10.3 Credit Risk Management
guidelines.text: External counterparty exposures – The maximum allowable unsecured external counterparty exposure for OTC derivative transactions is $500 million, based on the total net market value of all OTC positions held with each external counterparty. The total external counterparty exposure for each external counterparty, including the collateralized portions of these agreements, may not exceed 5% of the market value of the Total Fund. The minimum credit rating for an external counterparty (which may be a counterparty risk assessment or rating), based on a nationally recognized statistical rating organization (“NRSRO"), must be at least A- or better at the inception of the contract. For any external counterparty that experiences deterioration in credit quality that results in a NRSRO rating below the A- level, subsequent to the inception of transaction, additional eligible collateral may be posted, or the transaction may be terminated.

guidelines.section: 10.3 Credit Risk Management
guidelines.text: Repurchase agreements – The limit for each counterparty for repurchase transactions and tri-party repurchase transactions may not exceed 5% of the market value of the Total Fund. Each repurchase agreement will be entered into under a widely accepted industry-approved form, such as one approved by SIFMA. A counterparty to a repurchase agreement must be an organization rated A3/A- or better by a NRSRO, unless (i) the counterparty is another entity created by the Texas legislature; (ii) the counterparty is a money-market fund regulated under Rule 2a-7 under the Investment Company Act of 1940 or a fund designed to resemble such a money-market fund regulated under Rule 2a-7 or (iii) the counterparty is a pension fund or retirement system created by a government entity, whether non-U.S. or domestic and approved by the CIO.

guidelines.section: 10.3 Credit Risk Management
guidelines.text: Securities lending – ... A securities lending agent must be either (i) an organization rated A- or better by a NRSRO or (ii) insured by an organization rated A- or better by an NRSRO and execute a securities lending agreement as required by applicable law.

guidelines.section: 10.8 Risk Management Compliance Cure Periods and Remedies
guidelines.text: Passive violations – A passive violation occurs when the portfolio breaches a prescribed policy limit as the result of changing market or credit conditions. The Investment Division will report the violation to the Board and will remedy the violation within 90 days of the violation or prepare a written action plan that must be approved by Board resolution to extend the cure period beyond 90 days.

guidelines.section: 10.8 Risk Management Compliance Cure Periods and Remedies
guidelines.text: Active violations – An active violation is caused by entering into an agreement or investment that breaches a policy limit at inception or thereafter through failure to monitor. In this case, a thorough analysis of controls will ensue and be reported to the CIO, the Executive Director and the Chair of the appropriate Board committee, as soon as practical, and to the full Board at its next regularly scheduled meeting at which investment matters will be discussed. The Investment Division will seek to remedy the violation when possible. In instances where the costs of immediate remedies are prohibitive, the Investment Division will develop a corrective action plan that will be submitted to the CIO within a reasonable time after the violation occurs, not to exceed 15 days, depending on the nature and complexity of the investment holding and transactions needed to remedy the violation. The Board will be apprised of the violation at its next regularly scheduled meeting along with the corrective action plan.

guidelines.section: 10.9 Permitted Sources of Leverage Financing
guidelines.text: Leverage will not be used to exceed the risk parameters established by the asset allocation ranges of this Policy.

guidelines.section: 11.2 Authorized Investments for the Health Insurance Program Portfolio
guidelines.text: Section 404.024, Texas Government Code describes the Authorized Investments employed by the comptroller when he or she invests state funds. The Investment Division shall employ this list of Authorized Investments when the Investment Division invests the Health Insurance Program Portfolio.

guidelines.section: 12.6 Prohibitions
guidelines.text: Neither TRS nor any TRS investment shall be burdened with or liable for any Placement Fee.

guidelines.section: 12.6 Prohibitions
guidelines.text: No TRS investment may be made if the transaction involves either (a) a Placement Agent who is not registered with either of the Securities and Exchange Commission or the Financial Industry Regulatory Authority (“FINRA”), or (b) the sharing of a Placement Fee with a non- registered person or entity.

guidelines.section: 12.6 Prohibitions
guidelines.text: No TRS investment may be made if an authorized officer or the board, in consultation with legal counsel, determines that a disclosed contact with a Board member or Texas Candidate or Elected Official, or a contribution to a Texas Candidate or Elected Official, has created an unacceptable risk to the integrity and reputation of the TRS investment program or has been made in violation of a TRS policy or applicable law.

guidelines.section: TRACKING ERROR NEUTRAL (IN ANNUALIZED BASIS POINTS)
guidelines.text: The neutral tracking error for Equity (USA) is 300 basis points.

guidelines.section: TRACKING ERROR NEUTRAL (IN ANNUALIZED BASIS POINTS)
guidelines.text: The neutral tracking error for Equity (International; Non-US Developed, EAFE) is 300 basis points.

guidelines.section: TRACKING ERROR NEUTRAL (IN ANNUALIZED BASIS POINTS)
guidelines.text: The neutral tracking error for Equity (International; Emerging Markets) is 300 basis points.

guidelines.section: TRACKING ERROR NEUTRAL (IN ANNUALIZED BASIS POINTS)
guidelines.text: The neutral tracking error for Equity (All Country) is 300 basis points.

guidelines.section: TRACKING ERROR NEUTRAL (IN ANNUALIZED BASIS POINTS)
guidelines.text: The neutral tracking error for Stable Value Hedge Funds is 400 basis points.

guidelines.section: TRACKING ERROR NEUTRAL (IN ANNUALIZED BASIS POINTS)
guidelines.text: The neutral tracking error for Risk Parity is 400 basis points.

guidelines.section: TRACKING ERROR NEUTRAL (IN ANNUALIZED BASIS POINTS)
guidelines.text: The maximum tracking error for Government Bonds- Nominal is 300 basis points.

guidelines.section: TRACKING ERROR NEUTRAL (IN ANNUALIZED BASIS POINTS)
guidelines.text: The maximum tracking error for Government Bonds – Real is 300 basis points.

guidelines.section: TRACKING ERROR NEUTRAL (IN ANNUALIZED BASIS POINTS)
guidelines.text: The neutral tracking error for Total Public Fund Tracking Error is 100 basis points, and the maximum is 300 basis points.

guidelines.section: TRACKING ERROR NEUTRAL (IN ANNUALIZED BASIS POINTS)
guidelines.text: Tracking error will be measured on a realized basis over a three year period.

guidelines.section: IIC APPROVAL AUTHORITY AND MANAGER ORGANIZATION ALLOCATION LIMITS
guidelines.text: For Public Markets Portfolios, the Initial Allocation limit is 0.5%, the Additional or Follow-On Allocation limit is 1%, the Total Manager Organization Market Value Limit is 3%, and the Total Manager Organization Exposure Limit is 5%.

guidelines.section: IIC APPROVAL AUTHORITY AND MANAGER ORGANIZATION ALLOCATION LIMITS
guidelines.text: For the Private Equity Portfolio, the Initial Allocation limit is 0.5%, the Additional or Follow-On Allocation limit is 1%, the Total Manager Organization Market Value Limit is 3%, and the Total Manager Organization Exposure Limit is 5%.

guidelines.section: IIC APPROVAL AUTHORITY AND MANAGER ORGANIZATION ALLOCATION LIMITS
guidelines.text: For the Real Estate Portfolio, the Initial Allocation limit is 0.5%, the Additional or Follow-On Allocation limit is 1%, the Total Manager Organization Market Value Limit is 3%, and the Total Manager Organization Exposure Limit is 5%.

guidelines.section: IIC APPROVAL AUTHORITY AND MANAGER ORGANIZATION ALLOCATION LIMITS
guidelines.text: For the Energy, Natural Resources and Infrastructure Portfolio, the Initial Allocation limit is 0.5%, the Additional or Follow-On Allocation limit is 1%, the Total Manager Organization Market Value Limit is 3%, and the Total Manager Organization Exposure Limit is 5%.

structured.portfolio: Energy, Natural Resources and Infrastructure Portfolio

guidelines.section: IIC APPROVAL AUTHORITY AND MANAGER ORGANIZATION ALLOCATION LIMITS
guidelines.text: For Total IIC Approval Authority, each Manager Organization, the Total Manager Organization Market Value Limit is 6%, and the Total Manager Organization Exposure Limit is 10%.

structured.portfolio: Total IIC Approval Authority, each Manager Organization

guidelines.section: Authority for Special Investment Opportunities
guidelines.text: Notwithstanding the limits set forth in this Appendix B, the CIO may designate an investment opportunity as a "Special Investment Opportunity" if the circumstances indicate a reasonable probability that a rapid investment response will be required in order for TRS to acquire the investment in excess of the limits on Investment Division authority set forth in this Appendix B.

guidelines.section: Authority for Special Investment Opportunities
guidelines.text: If the opportunity will not be added to an agenda, and the CIO and the Executive Director conclude that the investment would be in the best interests of TRS, the CIO and the Executive Director may authorize and conclude an investment up to $1 billion in that Special Investment Opportunity.

guidelines.section: Authority for Special Investment Opportunities
guidelines.text: After one investment in a Special Investment Opportunity has been made, no further investment in a Special Investment Opportunity may be made until the Board has reauthorized the CIO's authority to designate a Special Investment Opportunity.

guidelines.section: CURRENCY HEDGE RATIOS
guidelines.text: The Currency Hedge Ratio for Public Markets Portfolios is 0%.

guidelines.section: CURRENCY HEDGE RATIOS
guidelines.text: The Currency Hedge Ratio for Private Markets Portfolios is 0%.

guidelines.section: A. External Advisory Committees or Boards and Board Observers
guidelines.text: A TRS investment-related agreement may provide that an Investment Division employee may represent TRS by serving: On an advisory committee, advisory board, or similar advisory body to a TRS investment vehicle, whether the position is voting or non-voting; or

guidelines.section: A. External Advisory Committees or Boards and Board Observers
guidelines.text: A TRS investment-related agreement may provide that an Investment Division employee may represent TRS by serving: As a non-voting TRS observer at meetings of the governing body of an investment vehicle, including a business entity, in which TRS has an interest.

guidelines.section: B. Board Representation by a TRS Employee
guidelines.text: The TRS employee representative may not serve in a position that under applicable law has general liability to third parties, such as a general partnership position.

guidelines.section: B. Board Representation by a TRS Employee
guidelines.text: Duties that an employee owes to TRS must be primary. TRS employees representing TRS must comply with recusal determinations made by the Executive Director in consultation with the Chief Compliance Officer and the General Counsel.

guidelines.section: B. Board Representation by a TRS Employee
guidelines.text: The external entity's insurance and indemnification will be primary relative to any available TRS liability and indemnification coverage.

guidelines.section: B. Board Representation by a TRS Employee
guidelines.text: If compensation or reimbursement of expenses will be paid, the agreement must require payment of any compensation or reimbursement directly to TRS.

guidelines.section: B. Board Representation by a TRS Employee
guidelines.text: A TRS employee representative must hold one of the following TRS titles to be eligible to serve: Director, Managing Director, Senior Managing Director, or CIO.

guidelines.section: B. Board Representation by a TRS Employee
guidelines.text: The CIO may not serve on an external governing body without prior authorization from the Executive Director.

guidelines.section: C. Board Representation by a Non-Employee Independent Third Party
guidelines.text: A third-party may not be TRS' agent and shall have full discretion when voting as a member of the governing body.

guidelines.section: C. Board Representation by a Non-Employee Independent Third Party
guidelines.text: TRS will not insure or indemnify any third party representative.

guidelines.section: C. Board Representation by a Non-Employee Independent Third Party
guidelines.text: The third party must be free of conflicts of interest. TRS will require delivery of a background check from a reputable investigatory firm.
